title: How to Make a Cupcake in the Microwave

steps.headline: Gather the ingredients.
steps.description: If you're planning on making this at work or where you study, measure out the cake mix in a small container with a lid, and the yogurt into another. On the way to work or studies, grab some soda water and place it all in the shared fridge in the staff or tea room until needed. Remember to also take along some suitable baking paper to line the cup with, so that it doesn't stick.

steps.headline: Mix together the cake mix, yogurt, and most of the soda water in a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Create a smooth consistency – there shouldn't be any lumps. Add the rest of the water and mix in thoroughly. If you don't have a bowl, mix straight in the cup, although this will be more challenging. Even a small breakfast bowl is suitable for this cupcake mix.

steps.headline: Lightly spray the microwave-safe cup with non-stick cooking spray or line with baking paper suitable for a microwave.
steps.description:
Carefully pour the batter into the cup. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/34\/03-cupcake-mixture-in-cup-ready-to-microwave.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/34\/03-cupcake-mixture-in-cup-ready-to-microwave.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

Image from: Flickr<\/a>
Taken by: admiller<\/a>
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Microwave for about 1 1/2 minutes on HIGH.
steps.description:
Monitor it closely, as microwaves vary in wattage and temperature. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/20\/04-cupcake-in-the-microwave.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/20\/04-cupcake-in-the-microwave.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

Image from: Flickr<\/a>
Taken by: admiller<\/a>
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} The cupcake will be ready when it starts to move away from the sides of the cup and changes from a liquid to forming a firm-looking, sponge-like top. Perform the toothpick test to see if it's done.

steps.headline: Allow the cupcake in a cup to cool for 10 minutes.
steps.description: Dress it up with whipped cream and sprinkle a few chocolate chips on top.

text:
Gather the ingredients. If you're planning on making this at work or where you study, measure out the cake mix in a small container with a lid, and the yogurt into another. On the way to work or studies, grab some soda water and place it all in the shared fridge in the staff or tea room until needed. Remember to also take along some suitable baking paper to line the cup with, so that it doesn't stick. Mix together the cake mix, yogurt, and most of the soda water in a mixing bowl. Create a smooth consistency – there shouldn't be any lumps. Add the rest of the water and mix in thoroughly. If you don't have a bowl, mix straight in the cup, although this will be more challenging. Even a small breakfast bowl is suitable for this cupcake mix. Lightly spray the microwave-safe cup with non-stick cooking spray or line with baking paper suitable for a microwave. Carefully pour the batter into the cup. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/3/34/03-cupcake-mixture-in-cup-ready-to-microwave.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/3/34/03-cupcake-mixture-in-cup-ready-to-microwave.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

Image from: Flickr
Taken by: admiller
License: Creative Commons

"} Microwave for about 1 1/2 minutes on HIGH. Monitor it closely, as microwaves vary in wattage and temperature. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/20/04-cupcake-in-the-microwave.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/20/04-cupcake-in-the-microwave.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

Image from: Flickr
Taken by: admiller
License: Creative Commons

"} The cupcake will be ready when it starts to move away from the sides of the cup and changes from a liquid to forming a firm-looking, sponge-like top. Perform the toothpick test to see if it's done. Allow the cupcake in a cup to cool for 10 minutes. Dress it up with whipped cream and sprinkle a few chocolate chips on top.
sentences: If you're planning on making this at work or where you study, measure out the cake mix in a small container with a lid, and the yogurt into another.
On the way to work or studies, grab some soda water and place it all in the shared fridge in the staff or tea room until needed.
Remember to also take along some suitable baking paper to line the cup with, so that it doesn't stick.
Mix together the cake mix, yogurt, and most of the soda water in a mixing bowl.
Create a smooth consistency – there shouldn't be any lumps.
Add the rest of the water and mix in thoroughly.
If you don't have a bowl, mix straight in the cup, although this will be more challenging.
Even a small breakfast bowl is suitable for this cupcake mix.
Lightly spray the microwave-safe cup with non-stick cooking spray or line with baking paper suitable for a microwave.
Carefully pour the batter into the cup.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/34\/03-cupcake-mixture-in-cup-ready-to-microwave.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/34\/03-cupcake-mixture-in-cup-ready-to-microwave.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} Microwave for about 1 1/2 minutes on HIGH.
Monitor it closely, as microwaves vary in wattage and temperature.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/20\/04-cupcake-in-the-microwave.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/20\/04-cupcake-in-the-microwave.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

Image from: Flickr<\/a>
Taken by: admiller<\/a>
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} The cupcake will be ready when it starts to move away from the sides of the cup and changes from a liquid to forming a firm-looking, sponge-like top.
Perform the toothpick test to see if it's done.
Allow the cupcake in a cup to cool for 10 minutes.
Dress it up with whipped cream and sprinkle a few chocolate chips on top.
tyn_section: Non-stick cooking spray or baking paper suitable for a microwave (cut a piece out to take with you if taking to work or studies)
Small mixing bowl. A breakfast bowl is suitable.
Small teacup (about 8 oz) which should be microwave-safe (no metallic paint)
